Name: Coptic textile
Description: Fragment of an oval tapestry cloth made in wool of a purple-violet colour. From one of its vertices a stem emerges, formed by a winding volute which ends in a vine leaf. The decoration, in linen of a natural colour, is worked with the flying spool and consists of a central part of highly schematic interlacings; the interior border forms a volute of circular motifs and the exterior a row of highly stylized vine leaves.
